intro: Mentzelia veatchiana, commonly known as Veatch's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale blue to lavender flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It has hairy foliage and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
